item.title: Asia Set for Cautious Open as Trump Doubles Down: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asia stocks are poised for a subdued open after a lackluster session on Wall Street as Donald Trump ruled out extending his August tariff deadline. US copper prices surged after the president called for a 50% levy on imports.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck

item.title: Why tariffs are the biggest issue for the US economy
item.description: Lanhee Chee of Hoover Institution joins Bloomberg "The Close" to discuss potentially new tariffs, 50% on copper, maybe 200% on pharmaceuticals. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Market 'shocks' largely policy-related: Deutsche Bank
item.description: Matthew Luzzetti of Deutsche Bank joins "Bloomberg "The Close" to discuss policy shocks waves through the market. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Hit a Wall of Tariff Worry | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Sonali Basak, Emily Graffeo and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Goldman Boosts Gray Media’s Junk Bond Sale on Strong Demand
item.description: Wall Street banks led by Goldman Sachs Group Inc. boosted a junk bond sale for broadcaster Gray Media Inc. to $900 million on Tuesday with better pricing for the borrower due to strong demand, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Gowri Gurumurthy

item.title: Baupost-Backed Tile Importer Files for Bankruptcy, Seeks Sale
item.description: Mosaic Cos., which sells tile and stone flooring, filed for bankruptcy with plans to sell its operations after the company’s main backer, an affiliate of investment giant Baupost Group, was unable to help the business navigate import problems that began during the Covid-19 pandemic.
item.dc:creator: Steven Church

media:content.media:description: A worker fits flooring tiles Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg

item.title: Evercore's Schlosstein on Economy, Fed and NYC Mayoral Race
item.description: Evercore Chair Emeritus Ralph Schlosstein says the US economy is in solid shape and the Federal Reserve is correct to stay patient on rates. Speaking with Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg The Close," Schlosstein also comments on the federal spending bill and the New York City mayoral race. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Power Firm AES Explores Options Amid Takeover Interest
item.description: AES Corp., which provides renewable power to tech giants such as Microsoft Corp., is exploring options including a potential sale amid takeover interest, people with knowledge of the matter said.
item.dc:creator: David Carnevali, Dinesh Nair, Eyk Henning, Ryan Gould

media:content.media:description: Wind turbines and power lines during a heatwave in Palm Springs, California, US, on Friday, July 14, 2023. Excessive heat warnings and watches are posted across California, Nevada and Arizona, where temperatures could near 120F (49C) in some places, the National Weather Service said. Photographer: Kyle Grillot/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump’s Copper Tariff Threats Are Already Raising Factory Costs
item.description: US President Donald Trump’s plans to place hefty import tariffs on copper have already caused a spike in costs for American factories, with New York futures trading 25% higher than other global benchmarks on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Mark Burton

media:content.media:description: An employee carries copper at Industrial Metal Supply Co.'s warehouse in San Diego, California, U.S., on Thursday, Jan. 24, 2013. Industrial Metal Supply Co. is an aluminum, steel and sheet metal supplier serving businesses and retail custmers.

item.title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman Talks Talent War, Trump and Musk
item.description: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman says he hasn’t spoken to Mark Zuckerberg since the Meta CEO poached some of OpenAI’s top engineers. Speaking with reporters at the Sun Valley conference, Altman also says he doesn’t feel represented by the Democratic Party.

item.title: Top Copper Nation Sweats on Details of Trump’s 50% Tariff
item.description: Chile, by far the biggest shipper of copper into the US, is waiting for details to emerge following President’s Donald Trump’s bombshell comments on tariffs.
item.dc:creator: James Attwood, Valentina Fuentes

media:content.media:description: Copper anodes are loaded for shipment at the Codelco El Olivar facility (ETEO) in El Olivar, Chile, on Wednesday, April 2, 2025. Copper extended its retreat from a nine-month high as sentiment in industrial metals markets soured ahead of new tariffs from US President Donald Trump.

item.title: US Copper Prices Surge to Record as Trump Calls for 50% Tariff
item.description: Copper futures in New York surged after US President Donald Trump said he planned to implement a 50% tariff on imports of the commodity, a move that’s likely to spark massive supply-chain ripples through global metal markets.
item.dc:creator: Doug Alexander, James Attwood

item.title: Stocks Hit a Wall as Trump’s Remarks Lift Copper: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks failed to gain traction near all-time highs, with Donald Trump saying the August deadline for the start of reciprocal tariffs won’t be extended, despite hopes he’s open to trade talks. Copper surged as the US president called for a 50% tariff. Treasuries fell.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Containers next to gantry cranes at a shipping terminal in Yokohama, Japan, on Tuesday, April 15, 2025. Japan is scheduled to release trade figures on April 17. Photographer: Toru Hanai/Bloomberg

item.title: Australian Pension Overseeing A$75 Billion Adds Private Equity
item.description: Mercer Superannuation Australia Ltd. will add private equity to its default pension options for the first time, joining a growing number of retirement funds in embracing the strategy to diversify their holdings.
item.dc:creator: Richard Henderson

media:content.media:description: Graeme Miller, chief investment officer of TelstraSuper Pty, during the Asia Pacific Financial and Innovation Symposium in Melbourne, Australia, on April 16, 2024. The Australian pension funds industry is seeking more private markets opportunities with Wall Street investors.

item.title: Emerging Market FX Wavers as Trump Tariff Comments Sow Confusion
item.description: Currencies across developing economies traded mixed on Tuesday as investors struggled to work out the implications of a second day of tariff announcements by President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Maria Elena Vizcaino

item.title: Nothing Phone Aims to Be Used Less
item.description: Smartphone startup Nothing debuts its Phone 3 with a design aimed to get consumers to use it less. Carl Pei, Nothing co-founder and CEO, joins joins Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CoreWeave CEO on Integrating Core Scientific
item.description: CoreWeave CEO Michael Intrator details the purchase of Core Scientific for $9 billion, saying it's part of a strategy to get "to scale" as AI demand growth continues. He joins Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Tech" to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SpaceX Valuation Said to Hit Around $400 Billion
item.description: SpaceX is discussing plans to raise money and sell insider shares in a deal that would value Elon Musk’s rocket and satellite maker at around $400 billion, people familiar with the matter said. Ed Ludlow has more on “Bloomberg The Close.”

item.title: Treasury Bulls Unwind Big Bets as Strong Data Pushes Yields Up
item.description: Futures traders have been unwinding some large bullish bets on Treasury bonds, adding to the recent upward pressure on US yields after a surprisingly strong jobs report last week.
item.dc:creator: Edward Bolingbroke

item.title: Treasuries Fall for Fifth Day as Pressure Builds Amid Auctions
item.description: US Treasuries fell for a fifth session as demand for long-term government debt across the globe wanes amid a flurry of bond auctions this week.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie, Greg Ritchie

item.title: Stocks End Lower as Traders Assess a Slew of Trade Headlines
item.description: US equities closed slightly lower Tuesday as traders sifted through a trove of trade-related news, including a warning from President Donald Trump that there won’t be any extensions to the new Aug. 1 tariff deadline, and potential new rates on imports of copper and pharmaceuticals.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Wall Street Bank Stocks’ Furious Rally Spurs HSBC Downgrades
item.description: HSBC is turning cautious on three of the biggest US bank stocks following a record rally that’s brought the group within shouting distance of an all-time high.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Griffin

media:content.media:description: A HSBC bank branch in Enfield, UK.

item.title: A Slow Start to Amazon's Prime Day
item.description: Amazon's Prime Day kicks off to a slower than expected start as early spending drops 14% compared to 2024. Bloomberg's Spencer Soper joins Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Tech" to discuss the tariff impact on retailers and shoppers. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Fair Isaac Drops as Pulte Lets Fannie, Freddie Use VantageScore
item.description: Shares in Fair Isaac Corp., known colloquially as FICO, declined after federal regulators said government-sponsored mortgage entities Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will be able to use a second firm when determining borrowers’ creditworthiness.
item.dc:creator: Norah Mulinda

media:content.media:description: Fannie Mae offices in Reston, Virginia.

item.title: Trump Tariffs 'A Long Time Coming': Krach Institute CEO
item.description: Michelle Giuda, CEO of the Krach Institute for Tech Diplomacy at Purdue says President Trump's tariffs will help to rebalance trade so the US can continue to lead in critical industries like tech. She joins Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Tech" to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: How Robots Are Helping Amazon Deliver on Prime Day
item.description: Amazon Robotics Vice President Scott Dresser explains how robots are helping Amazon employees deliver on Prime Day. He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oil Gains as Red Sea Attacks Spur Push Past Key Technical Level
item.description: Oil gained for a second straight session as technical levels exaggerated a rally on fresh tensions in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Catherine Cartier

item.title: A Bright Outlook for US Tech and Stocks
item.description: Jed Ellerbroek, portfolio manager at Argent Capital Management, says he sees continued strength in tech and US stocks as companies continue to invest in AI. He joins Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Apple's AI Model Executive Shifts to Meta
item.description: Apple's AI ambitions take another hit as a key executive in AI models leaves for Meta. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech” to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Apple Loses Top AI Models Exec to Meta’s Hiring Spree
item.description: Apple Inc.’s top executive in charge of artificial intelligence models is leaving for Meta Platforms Inc., another setback in the iPhone maker’s struggling AI efforts. Ruoming Pang, a distinguished engineer and manager in charge of the company’s Apple foundation models team, is departing, according to people with knowledge of the matter. Pang, who joined Apple from Alphabet Inc. in 2021, is the latest big hire for Meta’s new superintelligence group, said the people, who declined to be named discussing unannounced personnel moves. To secure Pang, Meta offered a package worth tens of millions of dollars per year, the people said. Meta Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg has been on a hiring spree, bringing on major AI leaders including Scale AI’s Alexandr Wang, startup founder Daniel Gross and former GitHub CEO Nat Friedman with high compensation. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reports on the latest with the tech giants. (Source: Bloomberg)
